docs.title: SNP calling workflow for Asclepias sequencing data
0. DNA extracted from plant tissue using the Qiagen DNeasy kit
docs.text: Libraries prepared with the PlexWell 96/384 library prep kit. Sequencing (paired end 150 bp) done on the Illumina HiSeq 2500 (Puzey)/Illumina HiSeq 4000 (the rest).

docs.title: 1. Trimming with trimmomatic 0.38
docs.text:
for file in *.fastq.gz; do

java -jar /opt/trimmomatic/0.38/prebuilt/trimmomatic-0.38.jar PE -threads 32 -phred33 -basein \(file -baseout "trmd\)file" ILLUMINACLIP:/opt/trimmomatic/0.38/prebuilt/adapters/TruSeq3-PE-2.fa:2:30:10 SLIDINGWINDOW:4:20 LEADING:3 TRAILING:3 MINLEN:36 done

docs.title: 2. Check trimming quality with FastQC
docs.text: fastqc --noextract --nogroup -t 16 *.fastq.gz

docs.title: 3a. Keep reads succesfuly mapped to A. syriaca nuclear genome (BBSplit 38.91)
docs.text: for R1 in *_1P.fastq.gz; do name=\({R1%_1P.fastq.gz} R2=\)_2P.fastq.gz bbsplit.sh in1=\(R1 in2=\)R2 ref=/syriaca_nu.fasta basename=${name}nu%.fq done

docs.title: 3b. Filter out non-nuclear reads
docs.text: for i in *nu_clean.fq; do bbsplit.sh in=\(i ref=/references/syriaca_cp.fasta,/references/syriaca_mt.fasta basename=\)nu.clean.fq int=t }.out_%.fq outu=${i done

docs.title: 4. Mapping to the reference (index the reference with bwa index before starting)
docs.text: module load bwa/0.7.17 for i in *_nu_clean.fq; do bwa mem -t 32 \/references/syriaca_nu.fasta $R1 '\(R2 > /sams/\).sam done

docs.title: 5. Sam to bam conversion, fixmates
docs.text: module load samtools for i in *.sam; do samtools sort -@ 16 -n -O sam \'$i | samtools fixmate -@ 16 -m -O bam - ${i:0:4}.bam done

docs.title: 6. Samtools_sort
docs.text: module load samtools for i in *.bam; do samtools sort -@ 16 -O bam '\(i > /sorted/\).bam done

docs.title: 7. Samtools_mark_duplicates
docs.text: module load samtools samtools markdup -@ 16 -r -S '\(i /dupped/\).bam done

docs.title: 8. Filtering by mapping quality (30)
docs.text: module load samtools for i in *.bam; do samtools view -h -b -q 30 '\(i > /Q30/\).bam done

docs.title: 9. Idex bam files
docs.text: module load samtools for i in *.bam; do samtools index -@ 16 '$i done

docs.title: 10. SNP calling with freebayes-parallel 1.3.1
docs.text: module load anaconda2/2019.10 freebayes-parallel /references/ref.fasta.100000.regions 32 -f /references/syriaca_nu.fasta -L samples.list --ploidy 2 > snps_all.vcf

docs.title: 11. Vcf compression
docs.text: module load htslib for i in *.vcf; do bgzip $i done

docs.title: 12. Indexing with tabix
docs.text: module load htslib for i in *.gz; do tabix -p vcf '$i done

docs.title: 13. Filtering with bcftools.
docs.text:
Parameters: remove indels, quality score > 30, 5 percent of missing data per locus, minor allele frequency > 0.05, mean depth > 3, no loci in LD (r2 > 0.2)).

bcftools view --types snps snps_all.vcf | bcftools view -i 'MIN(FMT/DP)>3 & MIN(FMT/GQ)>30 & F_MISSING < 0.05 & MAF > 0.05' | bcftools +prune -m 0.2 -w 1000 -Ov -o snps_all_filtered.vcf

docs.title: Postdoctoral  Research Associate at the University of Arizona
docs.text:
Research interests: Population genetics, genomics, evolutionary biology, molecular ecology

My research mostly focuses on studying processes that drive species diversification and shape the morphological and genetic variation within and between species.

docs.title: 1. Data Description
docs.text: Data consist of pair-end Illumina reads (150 bp; Illumina HiSeq 4000) for 234 Asclepias individuals.

docs.title: 2. Data Collection
docs.text: The genomic sequences for the Asclepias samples were obtained by extracting DNA from plant tissue using the Qiagen DNeasy kit and sequencing on the Illumina HiSeq platform.

docs.title: 3. Data Storage and Backup
docs.text: All project-related files are stored on a remote server and regularly backed up on an external hard drive.

docs.title: 4. Data Organization and Documentation
docs.text: Corresponding sample location, collector name, and the accompanying metadata will be made available upon publication.

docs.title: 5. Data Preservation and Long-Term Access
docs.text: All data sets used in the project are (or will be) deposited at the Genbank Short Read Archive and FigShare.

docs.title: 6. Data Sharing and Access
docs.text: The raw sequencing data are publicly available on the SRA under the BioProject PRJNA988843 Genbank.

docs.title: 7. Data Ethics and Legal Compliance
docs.text: No ethics approval was needed for this study.

docs.title: 8. Roles and Responsibilities
docs.text: Participants: Joshua Puzey, Elizabeth Davies, Carrie Olson-Manning, Sydney Kreutzmann, and Mark Fishbein. V. A. and C. O-M. and S. K. performed fieldwork, and V. A., L.D. and S.K. generated sequence data. V. A. analyzed the data.

docs.title: 9. Budget and Resources
docs.text:
Several grant sourses provided funding for sequensing effort and data storage.

This Data Management Plan ensures responsible collection, storage, and sharing of short read sequensing data. It promotes the transparency, reproducibility, and accessibility of population genetics and hybridization research.

docs.title: Introduction
docs.text: This document defines the degree of involment and responsibilities of every person of the research group into the Asclepias hybridization project.

docs.title: Project Overview and Objectives
docs.text: The Asclepias hybridization project is dedicated to investigation of morphological and genetic consequences of hybridization between A. speciosa and A. syriaca and study of the resulting hybrid zone.

docs.title: Research group
docs.text: The research group includes Victor Andreev and Mark Fishbein at the Oklahoma State University, Joshua Puzey and Elizabeth Davies at the College of William & Mary, and Carrie Olson-Manning and Sydney Kreutzmann at the Augustana University.

docs.title: Operations
docs.text: In order to ensure effective and smooth execution of the research project we have outlined specific communications and procedures.

docs.title: Communications
docs.text:
Internal communications: communications within the institutions is carried out via in-person weekly meetings, regular email exchange, and Zoom meetings.

External communications: communications between the groups is carried out via email exchange (as necessary), and biweekly Zoom meetings.

docs.title: Procedures
docs.text: All of the code and notes required for recreating the results of this research is stored in the dedicated GitHub repository at https://github.com/victor-andreev/asclepias

docs.title: Open Science Commitment
docs.text:
We are committed to Open Science as we operate through transparency, collaboration, and accessibility, guided by theFAIR (Findable, Accessible, Interoperable, Reusable) and CARE (Collective Benefit, Accountability, Responsibility, Equity) principles.

Our educational materials and publications are thoughtfully curated to align with Open Science ideals.

docs.title: Diversity Statement
docs.text: We encourage everyone to participate and are committed to building a community for all. Although this list cannot be exhaustive, we explicitly honor diversity in age, gender, gender identity or expression, culture, ethnicity, language, national origin, political beliefs, profession, race, religion, sexual orientation, socioeconomic status, and technical ability. We will not tolerate discrimination based on any of the protected characteristics above, including participants with disabilities.

docs.title: To succesfully run the analyses the following list of software is needed:
docs.text:
• Trimmomatic 0.38
  • Fastqc 0.11.8
  • BBSplit 38.91 (included into the BBmap package)
  • Bwa 0.7.17
  • Samtools 1.19.2
  • Freebayes-parallel 1.3.1
  • Bcftools 1.19
  • Htslib 1.19.1

Please install the required packages from the reps for your linux distributive and bioconda and conda-forge.

I would recommend using micromamba for managing your conda environments and packages.
